_comment: Created by ianb on 14/10/2013 11:40:08 using v0.9
title: How do admissions for falls vary by age?
analysis_commentary: In 2011/12, the rate of hospital admissions for falls decreases with age for both genders until age 30-34, when males have more admissions for falls than females. From age 30-34, rates of admission begin to increase slowly until people reach 60-64, when rates increase more steeply in females. Past the age of 60, rates of admissions for falls increase sharply, with rates for females reaching nearly double that for males.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Hospital Episode Statistics (Copyright 2013, Re-used with the permission of the Health & Social Care Information Centre. All rights reserved)
